column4: Hi, when i try to compile alsa i have this error:  checking for kernel version... The file /lib/modules/2.6.25.14/source/include/linux/version.h does not exist.
can you help me?
why are you compiling alsa
i have recompiled the kernel but i have no audio:(
some one tell me recompile alsa will fix the problem!:(
what problem
no audio installed
can you help me??
i have reinstalled 6 times ubuntu:(
is this hardy heron? also does sound work on initial install (or via live cd)? when did it stop working if so
yes the sound works fine!!! but i have to recompile the kernel to enable the pae
for the extra ram I presume
exact! the 64 bit ubuntu is not for me!
why not use 32bit then; how much ram do you have
i have 4gigs, and they works now whit the pae but, when i recompiled the kernel... the audio stops working...
compiling your own kernel is really not the best option if you are not sure what you are doing; have you asked in #alsa yet?
and i tried to recompile alsa... whit sources but i dont have version.h
no i don't!
but is the only thing for have 4gig ram
what about 64 bit live cd; does that work?
fixing flash for 64bit is much easier than what you are trying to do :)
